sentences.english: All my friends do not smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友并不全都吸烟。

sentences.english: Then you must be my cousin.
sentences.chinese: 那么你一定是我的远亲了。

sentences.english: You should keep in with your colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 你应当与你的同事友好相处。

sentences.english: You should not deprecate your own worth.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该贬低你自己的价值。

sentences.english: Her name is Mandy Wilson.
sentences.chinese: 她的名字是曼迪•威尔逊。

sentences.english: What’s your name?
sentences.chinese: 你叫什么名字？

sentences.english: He didn’t want to do anything to damage the good name of the company.
sentences.chinese: 他不想做任何有损公司良好声誉的事。

sentences.english: They’re a lot better than some airlines I could name.
sentences.chinese: 他们比我叫得上名字的一些航空公司要好得多。

detailed_translations.english: what someone is called
to say what the name of someone or something is, especially officially

sentences.english: the city’s new hospital
sentences.chinese: 市里新建的医院

sentences.english: the new issue of ‘Time’ magazine
sentences.chinese: 新一期《时代周刊》

sentences.english: new products on the market
sentences.chinese: 市场上的新产品

sentences.english: The hardest part of this job is understanding the new technology.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作最难的地方是理解新技术。

sentences.english: a young man with new ideas
sentences.chinese: 一个有新观念的年轻人

detailed_translations.english: recently made, built, invented, written, designed etc

sentences.english: I arrived here two years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我两年前来到这里。

sentences.english: We’ve known each other for over a year.
sentences.chinese: 我们相识一年多了。

sentences.english: It’s almost a year since Sue died.
sentences.chinese: 休去世快一年了。

sentences.english: Jodi is 15 years old.
sentences.chinese: 约迪15岁。

sentences.english: a three-year business plan
sentences.chinese: 三年的业务发展计划

sentences.english: a four-year-old child
sentences.chinese: 四岁的孩子

detailed_translations.chinese: 年；年度；历年；年纪；一年的期间；某年级的学生
detailed_translations.english: a period of about 365 days or 12 months, measured from any particular time

sentences.english: an old man
sentences.chinese: 一位老人

sentences.english: How old are you?
sentences.chinese: 你多大年纪？

sentences.english: Are you older than Sally?
sentences.chinese: 你比萨莉大吗？

sentences.english: You’re old enough to get your own breakfast now.
sentences.chinese: 你现在已经长大，可以自己弄早餐了。

sentences.english: I’m not coming skating. I’m too old for that now.
sentences.chinese: 我不去玩溜冰，我现在太老玩不动了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is old has lived for a very long time

sentences.english: If you wait three or four years, how old will you be when your hypothetical future kids graduate from high school or university?
sentences.chinese: 如果你在等个三四年的话，那你假象中的孩子高中毕业或者大学毕业的时候你自己都多少岁了呢？

sentences.english: Gary came top of the class in English.
sentences.chinese: 加里的英文是班里顶尖的。

sentences.english: a member of the landed class
sentences.chinese: 地主阶级的一员

sentences.english: He’s not in the same class (= not as good ) as her at tennis.
sentences.chinese: 他的网球水平并不如她。

detailed_translations.english: a group of students who are taught together

sentences.english: Pencils are graded according to softness.
sentences.chinese: 铅笔按软硬度分级。

sentences.english: The best grades of tea are expensive.
sentences.chinese: 最上等的茶叶价格很贵。

detailed_translations.english: to say what level of a quality something has, or what standard it is
a particular level of quality that a product, material etc has

sentences.english: Francis is the same age as me.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯和我同年岁。

sentences.english: Experts disagree over the age of the drawings.
sentences.chinese: 专家对这些画作的年代意见不统一。

sentences.english: Dad retired at the age of 56.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸是在56岁时退休的。

sentences.english: We are living in the age of technology.
sentences.chinese: 我们生活在科技时代。

sentences.english: He was worried to see how much she’d aged.
sentences.chinese: 看到她苍老了许多，他很担心。

detailed_translations.english: the number of years someone has lived or something has existed
to start looking older or to make someone or something look older

name: dear
trans: 亲爱的（用于书信中，表示客气）

sentences.english: Dear Sir or Madam, ...
sentences.chinese: 尊敬的先生或女士，…

sentences.english: Dear Mrs. Wilson, ...
sentences.chinese: 尊敬的威尔逊夫人，…

sentences.english: Dear Meg, ...
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的梅格，…

sentences.english: You're a lot like me, dear.
sentences.chinese: 你和我太像了，亲爱的。

detailed_translations.english: used before someone’s name or title to begin a letter
You can call someone dear as a sign of affection

sentences.english: the human body
sentences.chinese: 人体

sentences.english: My fingers were numb and my whole body ached.
sentences.chinese: 我手指麻木，浑身疼痛。

sentences.english: He needs to overcome a negative body image (=  what you think about your own body  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他需要克服对自己身体的负面印象。

sentences.english: A dog found the body of a girl in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 一条狗在树林里发现了一具女孩的尸体。

sentences.english: the main body of the text
sentences.chinese: 课文的正文

detailed_translations.english: the physical structure of a person or animal

sentences.english: He kissed the top of her head.
sentences.chinese: 他吻了一下她的头顶。

sentences.english: Alan fell asleep as soon as he put his head on the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦头一挨枕头就睡着了。

sentences.english: They dived head first into the water.
sentences.chinese: 他们一头跳进水中。

sentences.english: She was dressed in black from head to foot (= over all her body ).
sentences.chinese: 她从头到脚穿了一身黑。

sentences.english: He still has a full head of hair (= has all his hair, even though he is getting rather old ).
sentences.chinese: 他依然满头浓发。

sentences.english: Jenny marched proudly at the head of the procession.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮自豪地走在游行队伍的前列。

sentences.english: David was asked to head up the technical team.
sentences.chinese: 戴维被要求领导技术小组。

detailed_translations.english: the top part of your body that has your face at the front and is supported by your neck
to be in charge of a team, government, organization etc

sentences.english: Her hair was short and dark.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发又短又黑。

sentences.english: a short fat man with no hair on his head
sentences.chinese: 光头的矮胖男人

sentences.english: The cat has left white hairs all over the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 白色的猫毛掉得满沙发都是。

detailed_translations.english: the mass of things like fine threads that grows on your head

sentences.english: Dave has a broken arm .
sentences.chinese: 戴夫手臂断了。

sentences.english: Tim’s mother put her arms around him.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆的母亲伸出双臂搂着他。

sentences.english: Pat was carrying a box under his arm .
sentences.chinese: 帕特腋下挟着一个盒子。

sentences.english: He had a pile of books in his arms .
sentences.chinese: 他抱着一摞书。

sentences.english: They walked along the beach arm in arm (=  with their arms bent around each other’s  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们臂挽臂走在沙滩上。

sentences.english: The old lady rushed to greet him, arms outstretched .
sentences.chinese: 老太太张开双臂，快步上前迎接他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门
detailed_translations.english: one of the two long parts of your body between your shoulders and your hands
to provide weapons for yourself, an army, a country etc in order to prepare for a fight or a war

sentences.english: Steve gripped the steering wheel tightly with both hands.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫双手紧握方向盘。

sentences.english: In her hand was a tattered old photograph.
sentences.chinese: 她手中拿着的是一张破旧的老照片。

sentences.english: the hour hand
sentences.chinese: 时针

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body at the end of your arm, including your fingers and thumb, that you use to hold things

sentences.english: a young boy with skinny legs
sentences.chinese: 双腿干瘦的小男孩

sentences.english: She fell and broke her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她摔断了腿。

detailed_translations.english: one of the long parts of your body that your feet are joined to, or a similar part on an animal or insect

sentences.english: Was anyone hurt in the accident?
sentences.chinese: 事故中有人受伤吗？

sentences.english: Put that thing down - you might hurt someone with it.
sentences.chinese: 快把那东西放下，你会伤着别人的。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to hurt your feelings.
sentences.chinese: 我不是故意要伤害你的感情。

detailed_translations.english: to injure yourself or someone else

sentences.english: If there’s anything I can do to help, just give me a call.
sentences.chinese: 如果需要我帮忙，就给我打个电话。

sentences.english: Thank you for all your help.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你的一切帮助。

detailed_translations.english: to make it possible or easier for someone to do something by doing part of their work or by giving them something they need
things you do to make it easier or possible for someone to do something

sentences.english: I have some bad news for you.
sentences.chinese: 我有坏消息要告诉你。

sentences.english: I thought things couldn’t possibly get any worse.
sentences.chinese: 我想事情最坏也不过如此了。

sentences.english: The plane was delayed for several hours by bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 天气不好，飞机延误了好几个小时。

sentences.english: It’s difficult to break bad habits.
sentences.chinese: 坏习惯很难改。

sentences.english: a bad smell
sentences.chinese: 难闻的气味

detailed_translations.english: unpleasant or likely to cause problems

sentences.english: The dog bit him and made his hand bleed.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗把他的手咬出血了。

sentences.english: The dog’s been badly bitten by fleas.
sentences.chinese: 狗被跳蚤咬得很厉害。

detailed_translations.english: to use your teeth to cut, crush, or chew something

sentences.english: Joe ran his tongue over his dry lips.
sentences.chinese: 乔舔了舔干燥的嘴唇。

sentences.english: The taste of the chocolate was still on her tongue.
sentences.chinese: 巧克力的余味依然留在她的舌尖。

sentences.english: The girl scowled at me, then stuck out her tongue .
sentences.chinese: 女孩怒视着我，然后吐了一下舌头。

detailed_translations.english: the soft part inside your mouth that you can move about and use for eating and speaking
to use your tongue to make separate sounds when playing a musical instrument

sentences.english: He kicked the door hard.
sentences.chinese: 他用力踢门。

sentences.english: The boys were kicking a ball around in the yard.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们在院子里踢球。

sentences.english: She gave him a kick on the shin.
sentences.chinese: 她朝他的小腿踢了一脚。

detailed_translations.english: to hit sb/sth with your foot
a movement with the foot or the leg, usually to hit sth with the foot

sentences.english: I hated those cold winter mornings.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌冬天里寒冷的早晨。

sentences.english: I’m not feeling very well this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上我觉得不大舒服。

sentences.english: He stayed in bed late on Sunday morning.
sentences.chinese: 星期日早上他睡到很晚。

sentences.english: She took the early morning train.
sentences.chinese: 她搭乘了一大早的火车。

detailed_translations.english: the early part of the day, from when the sun rises until 12 o’clock in the middle of the day

sentences.english: There’s a meeting on Thursday afternoon .
sentences.chinese: 星期四下午有个会议。

sentences.english: It was very hot in the afternoon .
sentences.chinese: 下午很热。

sentences.english: See you tomorrow afternoon .
sentences.chinese: 明天下午见。

sentences.english: Are you going into town this afternoon ?
sentences.chinese: 今天下午你进城去吗？

sentences.english: We met in the early afternoon .
sentences.chinese: 下午较早的时候我们见了面。

sentences.english: By late afternoon , Micky had changed his mind.
sentences.chinese: 到了傍晚，米基已改变了主意。

sentences.english: He was having his afternoon nap .
sentences.chinese: 他在睡午觉。

detailed_translations.english: the part of the day after the morning and before the evening

sentences.english: A brief summary is given on a separate sheet.
sentences.chinese: 摘要另写一页。

sentences.english: It says torture and summary execution are common.
sentences.chinese: 据说酷刑和草草处决很常见。

detailed_translations.english: a short statement that gives the main information about something, without giving all the details
a summary report, statement etc gives the main facts in a report etc without any of the details or explanations

sentences.english: She had a beautiful face.
sentences.chinese: 她面容秀美。

sentences.english: Her face was white with fear.
sentences.chinese: 她吓得脸煞白。

sentences.english: A big smile spread across his face.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸上绽开了灿烂笑容。

sentences.english: I felt like punching him in the face.
sentences.chinese: 我真想给他脸上来一拳。

sentences.english: The birds build their nests in the rock face.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸟在岩壁上筑巢。

detailed_translations.english: the front part of your head, where your eyes, nose, and mouth are

sentences.english: He’s got beautiful eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他有一双漂亮的眼睛。

sentences.english: There were tears in her eyes as she listened to the story.
sentences.chinese: 她听故事时眼里噙着泪水。

sentences.english: A surgeon needs a good eye and a steady hand.
sentences.chinese: 做外科医生眼要准，手要稳。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two parts of the body that you use to see with

sentences.english: Someone punched him on the nose.
sentences.chinese: 有人一拳打在他的鼻子上。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a person’s or animal’s face used for smelling or breathing

sentences.english: He lifted his glass to his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他把玻璃杯举到嘴边。

sentences.english: Liam was fast asleep with his mouth wide open.
sentences.chinese: 利亚姆大张着嘴，睡得很熟。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your face which you put food into, or which you use for speaking

sentences.english: She tucked her hair behind her ears.
sentences.chinese: 她把头发拢到耳朵背后。

detailed_translations.english: one of the organs on either side of your head that you hear with

sentences.english: Would you like some bread with your soup?
sentences.chinese: 你喝汤时要吃点面包吗？

sentences.english: a loaf of brown bread
sentences.chinese: 一条黑面包

sentences.english: a piece of bread and butter
sentences.chinese: 一块黄油面包

detailed_translations.english: a type of food made from flour and water that is mixed together and then baked

sentences.english: We had cake and ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 我们吃了蛋糕和冰激凌。

sentences.english: a chocolate cake
sentences.chinese: 巧克力蛋糕

detailed_translations.english: a soft sweet food made by baking a mixture of flour, butter, sugar, and eggs

sentences.english: Try to eat plenty of fresh fruit .
sentences.chinese: 尽量多吃新鲜水果。

sentences.english: fruit and vegetables
sentences.chinese: 水果和蔬菜

sentences.english: a glass of fruit juice
sentences.chinese: 一杯果汁

sentences.english: a large garden with fruit trees
sentences.chinese: 种了果树的大花园

sentences.english: I’m looking forward to retirement and having time to enjoy the fruits of my labour (= the results of my hard work ) .
sentences.chinese: 我盼望着退休，好有时间来享受自己的劳动成果。

detailed_translations.english: something that grows on a plant, tree, or bush, can be eaten as a food, contains seeds or a stone, and is usually sweet

sentences.english: I like ice cream and cookies as much as the next guy. But I hate how it makes me feel afterward.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢冰淇淋和曲奇，但我又讨厌吃完之后所带给我的感受，疲倦，瞌睡，精力不集中等等。

sentences.english: If you enjoy chocolate ice cream, as I do, when confronted with a tub of it would you also enjoy eating as much of the tub as possible?
sentences.chinese: 如果你像我一样喜欢吃巧克力冰淇淋，那么当你面前放着一桶这样的冰淇淋时，你是否会敞开肚子尽量多吃呢？

sentences.english: On the morning of the stroke, I woke up to a pounding pain behind my left eye. And it was the kind of pain, caustic pain, that you get when you bite into ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 那 天早上，我从睡梦中醒来，发现自己的左脑疼痛不止，那种痛楚跟你咬冰淇淋的那种腐蚀性的感觉一样，它抓住我，然后又放开，然后再次抓住，再次放开。

sentences.english: Marie stood at the sink, peeling potatoes (= cutting off the skin ) .
sentences.chinese: 玛丽站在洗涤槽边削土豆皮。

detailed_translations.chinese: [作物] 土豆，[作物] 马铃薯
detailed_translations.english: a round white vegetable with a brown, red, or pale yellow skin, that grows under the ground

sentences.english: He staked his tomato vines with bamboo.
sentences.chinese: 他用竹竿支撑起西红柿秧。

sentences.english: Secondly,put some tomato paste on the bread.
sentences.chinese: 第二，放一些西红柿在面包上粘贴。

sentences.english: The salmon was brought to the table whole, garnished with parsley and slices of tomato and cucumber.
sentences.chinese: 整条大麻哈鱼被端上了桌，并用欧芹、西红柿片和黄瓜片作为花色配菜。

detailed_translations.english: a round soft red fruit eaten raw or cooked as a vegetable

sentences.english: I gave up eating meat a few months ago.
sentences.chinese: 我几个月以前开始不吃肉了。

sentences.english: raw meat
sentences.chinese: 生肉

sentences.english: a meat pie
sentences.chinese: 肉馅饼

sentences.english: a selection of cold meats
sentences.chinese: 各种冷盘肉

detailed_translations.english: the flesh of animals and birds eaten as food

sentences.english: I’ve got a present for you.
sentences.chinese: 我有件礼物送给你。

sentences.english: Someone left a message for Vicky.
sentences.chinese: 有人给维基留了言。

sentences.english: an English course for foreign students
sentences.chinese: 为外国学生开的一门英语课程

sentences.english: WWhat did you do that for?
sentences.chinese: 你那样做是为了什么？

sentences.english: We could hardly see for the mist.
sentences.chinese: 由于雾气，我们几乎什么也看不见。

detailed_translations.english: used to say who is intended to get or use something, or where something is intended to be used

sentences.english: a can of cola
sentences.chinese: 一罐可乐

detailed_translations.chinese: 可乐；可乐树（其子含咖啡碱）
detailed_translations.english: a brown sweet  soft drink  , or a bottle, can, or glass of this drink

sentences.english: People say the judge had been bought by the Mafia.
sentences.chinese: 人们都说法官被黑手党收买了。

detailed_translations.english: to pay money to someone, especially someone in a position of authority, in order to persuade them to do something dishonest
to pay money to someone, especially someone in a position of authority, in order to persuade them to do something dishonest

sentences.english: a tasty sauce served with rice or pasta
sentences.chinese: 配米饭或意面的美味酱汁

sentences.english: a plate of brown rice
sentences.chinese: 一盘糙米饭

sentences.english: Serve with plain boiled rice .
sentences.chinese: 配白米饭一起上桌。

sentences.english: a few grains of rice
sentences.chinese: 几粒大米

detailed_translations.english: a food that consists of small white or brown grains that you boil in water until they become soft enough to eat

sentences.english: Do you like rice or noodles?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢米饭还是面条？

sentences.english: They like to eat hamburgers, pizza and sandwiches but we always eat rice, congee, and noodles.
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢吃汉堡包，比萨饼和三明治，但是我们总是吃米饭，稀粥和面条。

sentences.english: Have you ever eaten noodles before?
sentences.chinese: 你以前吃过面条吗？

detailed_translations.english: Noodles are long, thin strips of pasta. They are used especially in Chinese and Italian cooking.

sentences.english: Over 1,500 different species of fish inhabit the waters around the reef.
sentences.chinese: 那片礁石周围的水域生活着1,500多种不同的鱼类。

sentences.english: The stonefish is the most deadly of all fishes.
sentences.chinese: 石鱼是所有鱼类中毒性最强的。

sentences.english: You usually drinks white wine with fish.
sentences.chinese: 白葡萄酒一般配鱼喝

sentences.english: Dad really loves to fish.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸很喜欢钓鱼。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that lives in water, and uses its fins and tail to swim
to try to catch fish

sentences.english: Lionel built a coop so that they could raise chickens and have a supply of fresh eggs.
sentences.chinese: 莱昂内尔搭建了一个鸡笼，这样他们就可以养鸡，得到新鲜鸡蛋。

sentences.english: roast chicken
sentences.chinese: 烤鸡

detailed_translations.english: a common farm bird that is kept for its meat and eggs

sentences.english: Blackbirds lay their eggs in March.
sentences.chinese: 乌鸫在3月产蛋。

sentences.english: an ostrich egg
sentences.chinese: 鸵鸟蛋

sentences.english: The eggs hatch (= break open to allow the baby out ) in 26 days.
sentences.chinese: 这些蛋要26天才能孵化。

sentences.english: Joe always has bacon and egg for breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 乔早餐总是吃熏肉加蛋。

detailed_translations.english: a round object with a hard surface, that contains a baby bird, snake, insect etc and which is produced by a female bird, snake, insect etc

sentences.english: If she hadn’t ducked, the ball would have hit her.
sentences.chinese: 如果她没有弯腰躲闪的话，那个球就可能击中她了。

sentences.english: Tim ducked down to comb his hair in the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆低下身在镜子前梳头发。

sentences.english: She ducked her head to look more closely at the inscription.
sentences.chinese: 她低下头更仔细地看碑文。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鸭子似的突然扎入水中； 突然低下
detailed_translations.english: to lower your head or body very quickly, especially to avoid being seen or hit
a very common water bird with short legs and a wide beak, used for its meat, eggs, and soft feathers

sentences.english: Lionel built a coop so that they could raise chickens and have a supply of fresh eggs.
sentences.chinese: 莱昂内尔搭建了一个鸡笼，这样他们就可以养鸡，得到新鲜鸡蛋。

sentences.english: roast chicken
sentences.chinese: 烤鸡

detailed_translations.english: a common farm bird that is kept for its meat and eggs

sentences.english: The rabbit disappeared in the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 那只兔子消失在树丛中。

sentences.english: At this time, a robust rabbit said: "No, or eat me !
sentences.chinese: 这时，一只健壮的兔子又说：“不，还是先吃我吧！

sentences.english: Mother rabbit told him that he was old enough to eat other food, but not keep pestering her to suckle.
sentences.chinese: 兔妈妈让他不要老缠着妈妈吃奶，他已经能够自己去吃些别的东西啦。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal with long ears and soft fur, that lives in a hole in the ground

sentences.english: They have two pets – a cat and a dog.
sentences.chinese: 他们有两只宠物，一只猫和一只狗。

sentences.english: We weren’t allowed to keep pets at school.
sentences.chinese: 学校里不许我们养宠物。

sentences.english: Rabbits make good pets .
sentences.chinese: 兔子是很好的宠物。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["pet food"]}
sentences.chinese: 宠物粮食

sentences.english: a pet shop
sentences.chinese: 宠物商店

sentences.english: The policeman reached down and petted the wolfhound.
sentences.chinese: 警察伸出手，摸了摸那条猎狼犬。

detailed_translations.english: an animal such as a cat or a dog which you keep and care for at home
If you pet a person or animal, you touch them in an affectionate way
a plan, idea, or subject that you particularly like or are interested in

sentences.english: A snake slithered across our path.
sentences.chinese: 一条蛇蜿蜒爬过我们的小路。

detailed_translations.english: an animal with a long thin body and no legs, that often has a poisonous bite
if a river, road, train, or line snakes somewhere, it moves in long twisting curves

sentences.english: ...a pet turtle.
sentences.chinese: …一只宠物龟。

detailed_translations.english: a  reptile  that lives mainly in water and has a soft body covered by a hard shell

sentences.english: a small piece of paper
sentences.chinese: 一小片纸

sentences.english: a small car
sentences.chinese: 一辆小汽车

sentences.english: a small town
sentences.chinese: 小镇

sentences.english: a small dark woman
sentences.chinese: 一个皮肤黝黑的小个子女人

sentences.english: The T-shirt was too small for him.
sentences.chinese: 这件 T 恤衫他穿太小了。

sentences.english: The sweater comes in three sizes - small, medium and large.
sentences.chinese: 这羊毛衫有三个尺寸: 小号、中号和大号。

sentences.english: Only a relatively small number of people were affected.
sentences.chinese: 只有相对少数的人受到了影响。

sentences.english: a small amount of money
sentences.chinese: 一小笔钱

sentences.english: A much smaller proportion of women are employed in senior positions.
sentences.chinese: 受雇担任高级职位的女性比例要小得多。

detailed_translations.chinese: 少的，小的；微弱的；几乎没有的；不重要的；幼小的
detailed_translations.english: not large in size or amount

sentences.english: He longed to see her again.
sentences.chinese: 到那里去要多长时间？

sentences.english: She longed for the chance to speak to him in private.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望有机会和他私下交谈。

detailed_translations.english: to want something very much, especially when it seems unlikely to happen soon

sentences.english: "What should I look for"?
sentences.chinese: 是要我寻找什么吗？

sentences.english: Not only this will happen but you will also look for his slightest mistakes then use them as proofs for what you have been told about him!!
sentences.chinese: 不仅这个将会发生，而且你也会寻找他最轻微的错误，然后将此作为他人告诉你他是怎么样的人的证据。

sentences.english: " so we can look for those features.
sentences.chinese: 这样我们就可以寻找那些特征。

sentences.english: The dog wagged its tail .
sentences.chinese: 那条狗摇了摇尾巴。

detailed_translations.english: the part that sticks out at the back of an animal’s body, and that it can move

sentences.english: Come on, let’s dance.
sentences.chinese: 来吧，我们跳舞吧。

sentences.english: The words danced before her tired eyes.
sentences.chinese: 这些字在她疲乏的眼前晃动。

sentences.english: The waltz is an easy dance to learn.
sentences.chinese: 华尔兹这种舞很容易学。

detailed_translations.english: to move your body to the sound and rhythm of music
a special set of movements performed to a particular type of music

sentences.english: The police played an elaborate game of cat and mouse to trap him.
sentences.chinese: 警方跟他玩了一场精心布局的猫捉老鼠游戏，诱他落网。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal with four legs that people often keep as a pet

sentences.english: I could hear a dog barking .
sentences.chinese: 我听到了狗吠声。

sentences.english: He’s taken the dog for a walk .
sentences.chinese: 他去遛狗了。

sentences.english: We used to have a dog when I was young.
sentences.chinese: 我小时候我们养过狗。

sentences.english: the most popular breed of dog
sentences.chinese: 最受人喜欢的犬种

detailed_translations.english: a common animal with four legs, fur, and a tail. Dogs are kept as pets or trained to guard places, find drugs etc.

sentences.english: wild birds
sentences.chinese: 野鸟

sentences.english: The dawn was filled with the sound of birds.
sentences.chinese: 黎明时分，鸟鸣声不绝于耳。

sentences.english: a flock of birds
sentences.chinese: 一群飞鸟

sentences.english: a wooden bird cage
sentences.chinese: 木制鸟笼

detailed_translations.english: a creature with wings and feathers that can usually fly. Many birds sing and build nests, and female birds lay eggs

sentences.english: Over 1,500 different species of fish inhabit the waters around the reef.
sentences.chinese: 那片礁石周围的水域生活着1,500多种不同的鱼类。

sentences.english: The stonefish is the most deadly of all fishes.
sentences.chinese: 石鱼是所有鱼类中毒性最强的。

sentences.english: You usually drinks white wine with fish.
sentences.chinese: 白葡萄酒一般配鱼喝

sentences.english: Dad really loves to fish.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸很喜欢钓鱼。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that lives in water, and uses its fins and tail to swim
to try to catch fish

sentences.english: The monkey is beating up and down.
sentences.chinese: 那只猴子到处乱窜。

sentences.english: The monkey engulfed the food whole.
sentences.chinese: 这只猴子囫囵吞下食物。

sentences.english: The monkey had deflowered an entire section of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 这只猴子把花园中一整块地方的花都糟蹋了。

detailed_translations.english: a small brown animal with a long tail, which uses its hands to climb trees and lives in hot countries

sentences.english: He came at me like a tiger.
sentences.chinese: 他像老虎一般地向我冲过来。

sentences.english: Or tiger ?
sentences.chinese: 或者老虎？

detailed_translations.english: a large wild animal that has yellow and black lines on its body and is a member of the cat family

sentences.english: a big house
sentences.chinese: 大房子

sentences.english: I need a bigger desk.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一张大一点的桌子。

sentences.english: She had a big grin on her face.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上挂着大大的笑容。

sentences.english: a big increase in crime
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率的大幅上升

sentences.english: Los Angeles is the biggest city in California.
sentences.chinese: 洛杉矶是加利福尼亚最大的城市。

sentences.english: The garage isn’t big enough for two cars.
sentences.chinese: 这个车库不够大，停不下两辆汽车。

sentences.english: When they lose, they lose in a big way (=  to a large degree  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们要输就输得很惨。

sentences.english: There was this great big (=  extremely big  ) spider in the sink.
sentences.chinese: 洗涤槽里有只特大的蜘蛛。

detailed_translations.english: of more than average size or amount

sentences.english: a short meeting
sentences.chinese: 一个短会

sentences.english: Morris gave a short laugh.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯笑了一声。

sentences.english: a short course on business English
sentences.chinese: 商业英语短期课程

sentences.english: Winter is coming and the days are getting shorter.
sentences.chinese: 冬天来临，白天变短了。

sentences.english: I’ve only been in Brisbane a short time .
sentences.chinese: 我才来布里斯班不久。

sentences.english: For a short while (= a short time ) , the city functioned as the region’s capital.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市曾经在很短的一段时间里是这个地区的首府。

sentences.english: I learned a lot during my short period as a junior reporter.
sentences.chinese: 在当初级记者的这段短暂时间里，我学到了许多。

sentences.english: Germany achieved spectacular economic success in a relatively short period of time .
sentences.chinese: 德国在相对较短的时间里取得了非凡的经济成就。

sentences.english: They met and married within a short space of time .
sentences.chinese: 他们从相识到结婚时间很短。

sentences.english: I promise to keep the meeting short and sweet (= short in a way that is good, especially not talking for a long time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我保证会议开得简短不拖拉。

sentences.english: For a few short weeks (= they seemed to pass very quickly ) the sun shone and the fields turned gold.
sentences.chinese: 短短的几个星期里，阳光照耀，田野变成了一片金黄。

detailed_translations.english: happening or continuing for only a little time or for less time than usual
a short film shown in the cinema
to almost do something but then decide not to do it

sentences.english: a baseball cap
sentences.chinese: 棒球帽

sentences.english: a bottle cap
sentences.chinese: 瓶盖

sentences.english: a graceful tower capped with a golden dome
sentences.chinese: 一座漂亮的金色圆顶塔

detailed_translations.english: a type of flat hat that has a curved part sticking out at the front, and is often worn as part of a uniform
to have a particular substance on top

sentences.english: Billy! Put your coat on , it’s cold outside!
sentences.chinese: 比利！穿上外套，外面很冷！

sentences.english: The kids took off their coats and threw them on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们脱下外套扔在地板上。

sentences.english: I need a new winter coat .
sentences.chinese: 我需要一件新的冬衣。

sentences.english: The lab assistants wear long white coats.
sentences.chinese: 实验室助手穿着白色的长外套。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing with long sleeves that is worn over your clothes to protect them or to keep you warm
to cover something with a thin layer of something else

sentences.english: Somebody pinched my sweater.
sentences.chinese: 有人偷了我的运动衫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 毛线衣，运动衫；大量出汗的人，发汗剂
detailed_translations.english: a piece of warm wool or cotton clothing with long sleeves, which covers the top half of your body

sentences.english: He unzipped his jacket.
sentences.chinese: 他拉开夹克衫的拉链。

sentences.english: The bitter wind cut through his jacket.
sentences.chinese: 刺骨的冷风吹透了他的夹克衫。

sentences.english: When I grew out of my jacket,I gave it to my little brother.
sentences.chinese: 我长得穿不下我的夹克衫了，便把它给我弟弟穿。

detailed_translations.english: a short light coat

sentences.english: His trousers were slightly too short.
sentences.chinese: 他的裤子有点短。

sentences.english: I need a new pair of trousers for work.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一条上班穿的新裤子。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing that covers the lower half of your body, with a separate part fitting over each leg

sentences.english: He shouldn’t be so selfish.
sentences.chinese: 他不该这么自私。

sentences.english: Why should anyone want to marry Tony?
sentences.chinese: 怎么竟然会有人意嫁给托尼？

detailed_translations.english: used to say what is the right or sensible thing to do

sentences.english: The cushions are starting to wear a little.
sentences.chinese: 这些靠垫开始有点磨破了。

sentences.english: His jeans have worn thin at the knees.
sentences.chinese: 他牛仔裤的膝盖处已经磨薄了。

sentences.english: You’ve worn a hole in your sock.
sentences.chinese: 你的袜子磨出了个洞。

detailed_translations.english: to become thinner or weaker after continuous use, or to make something do this

sentences.english: I can’t see you this week.
sentences.chinese: 我这星期不能见你。

detailed_translations.english: a period of seven days and nights, usually measured in Britain from Monday to Sunday and in the US from Sunday to Saturday

sentences.english: It will be dark soon.
sentences.chinese: 天很快就要黑了。

sentences.english: David arrived sooner than I expected.
sentences.chinese: 戴维到得比我预料的快。

sentences.english: ‘Who?’ ‘You’ll find out soon enough (= fairly soon ) .’
sentences.chinese: “谁？”“你很快就会知道的。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 快；不久，一会儿；立刻；宁愿
detailed_translations.english: in a short time from now, or a short time after something else happens

sentences.english: He was looking forward to working with the new manager.
sentences.chinese: 他很期待和新经理一起工作。

sentences.english: He now says that he's looking forward to increased trade after the war.
sentences.chinese: 他现在说他正期盼着战后的贸易增长。

detailed_translations.english: If you look forward to something that is going to happen, you want it to happen because you think you will enjoy it

sentences.english: She was wearing jeans and a T-shirt.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着牛仔裤和T恤衫。

detailed_translations.english: a soft shirt with short  sleeves  and no collar

sentences.english: I like your shorts, Jake.
sentences.chinese: 杰克， 我喜欢你的短裤。

sentences.english: Where are my shorts?
sentences.chinese: 我的短裤在哪里？

sentences.english: Now I have a cool pair of shorts for riding.
sentences.chinese: 现在我就有了一条骑车时的酷酷短裤啦！

detailed_translations.english: trousers reaching the top of the thigh or partway to the knee, worn by both sexes for sport, relaxing in summer, etc

sentences.english: ...a pair of knee-high socks.
sentences.chinese: …一双齐膝的短袜。

detailed_translations.english: Socks are pieces of clothing which cover your foot and ankle and are worn inside shoes

sentences.english: She wore a white blouse and a plain black skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着白衬衣和纯黑的裙子。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of outer clothing worn by women and girls, which hangs down from the waist like the bottom part of a dress
to avoid talking about an important subject, especially because it is difficult or embarrassing – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: a gentleman in evening dress
sentences.chinese: 穿晚礼服的绅士

sentences.english: The play was performed in modern dress (= clothes from the present time ) .
sentences.chinese: 这出戏里演员是现代装束。

detailed_translations.english: clothes for men or women of a particular type or for a particular occasion

sentences.english: I have to wear a shirt and tie to work.
sentences.chinese: 我上班要穿衬衫打领带。

sentences.english: a check shirt
sentences.chinese: 格子衬衫

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing that covers the upper part of your body and your arms, usually has a collar, and is fastened at the front by buttons

sentences.english: We always have snow in January.
sentences.chinese: 我们这里1月份总会下雪。

detailed_translations.english: the first month of the year, between December and February

sentences.english: He joined the Army in February 1943.
sentences.chinese: 他1943年2月参军。

detailed_translations.english: the second month of the year, between January and March

sentences.english: She started work here last March.
sentences.chinese: 她去年3月开始在这儿工作。

detailed_translations.english: the third month of the year, between February and April

sentences.english: You can paint, do repairs, and if you have already hired contractors in April or earlier, continue to work on your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你可以涂涂油漆，做点小修补，如果你已经在四月或更加之前就已经雇到承包商的话，按原计划进行没关系。

sentences.english: This past April while visiting my parents on the farm I’d grown up on, I wandered outside to drink in the feel of “home”, a comfort I really needed right then.
sentences.chinese: 刚刚过去的那个四月，我回到我在那长大的农场探望我的父母。 我在屋外漫步，沉浸在“家”的舒适感觉中——当时我真的很需要家的慰藉。

detailed_translations.english: the fourth month of the year, between March and May

sentences.english: Graduation ceremonies are held in early May.
sentences.chinese: 毕业典礼在5月初举行。

detailed_translations.english: the fifth month of the year, between April and June

sentences.english: He spent two and a half weeks with us in June 1986.
sentences.chinese: 1986年6月，他和我们呆了两个半星期。

detailed_translations.english: the sixth month of the year, between May and July

sentences.english: But from February through July, Joy sat around with nothing to do.
sentences.chinese: 但是从二月到七月，乔伊又无事可做了。

sentences.english: People still remembered the earthquake that had jarred this region last July.
sentences.chinese: 人们仍然记得去年七月发生的使该地区产生剧烈震动的那次地震。

sentences.english: One July a couple of years ago I took my supper with a Captain Moran on board the S.S. Margaret, that had put into a western river from I know not where.
sentences.chinese: 两年前的七月，我在玛格丽特号船上和一位名叫莫兰的船长共进晚餐，这艘船从我不熟悉的一个地方出发，驶往爱尔兰西部的某条河流。

sentences.english: He moved to another city last August.
sentences.chinese: 去年八月，他搬到另一座城市。

sentences.english: That night in August, waiting for the Rolling Stones to come on stage, we felt like rebels.
sentences.chinese: 在那个八月的夜晚，在等待滚石乐队登台演出时，我们有种造反的感觉。

sentences.english: They make a huge migration from the north to the south of the US, mostly starting in August and the other way around in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 大部分是从八月开始，它们开始进行巨大的迁徙，从美国的北部到南部，而到了春天又沿相反方向回来。

detailed_translations.english: the eighth month of the year, between July and September

sentences.english: The product suddenly took off in September.
sentences.chinese: 该产品在九月份突然热销起来。

sentences.english: Do I remember that September afternoon when I first met you?
sentences.chinese: 还记不记得第一次遇见你的那个九月的下午？

sentences.english: The carmaker is almost ready to launch out a new model in September.
sentences.chinese: 汽车制造商将于九月投产新型汽车。

detailed_translations.english: the ninth month of the year, between August and October

sentences.english: Most seasonal hiring is done in early October.
sentences.chinese: 多数季节性招聘是在10月初进行。

detailed_translations.english: the tenth month of the year, between September and November

sentences.english: And again in November.
sentences.chinese: 在十一月又一次。

sentences.english: Too much snow in November.
sentences.chinese: 太多的大雪在十一月。

detailed_translations.english: the 11th month of the year, between October and December

sentences.english: In the dark of December.
sentences.chinese: 在十二月的黑夜里。

sentences.english: Our summers are short and our winters long.In December, when it is darkest, we only have a few hours of very weak sunlight per day.
sentences.chinese: 我们的夏天很短但是冬天很长，在十二月，也就是最黑的时候，我们的一天中只有很短的时间可以看到微弱的阳光。

sentences.english: I send out Valentine’s cards with the girls’ photo, instead of trying to mail cards in December.
sentences.chinese: ——我寄出有女孩子照片的情人节贺卡，以代替试图在十二月寄出的贺卡。

detailed_translations.english: the 12th month of the year, between November and January

sentences.english: It’s my birthday on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 星期一是我的生日。

sentences.english: My aunt called to wish me a happy birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我姑妈打电话来祝我生日快乐。

sentences.english: The City of Cleveland Orchestra is celebrating its 200th birthday.
sentences.chinese: 克利夫兰市管弦乐队正在庆祝乐队成立200周年。

detailed_translations.english: the day in each year which is the same date as the one on which you were born

sentences.english: These results are firsts in the history of women’s athletics.
sentences.chinese: 这些成绩在女运动员历史上是第一次。

sentences.english: First I had to decide what to wear.
sentences.chinese: 首先我得决定穿什么。

detailed_translations.english: 1st
at the beginning

sentences.english: We’re having a small party this evening to celebrate our wedding anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 我们今晚有个小聚会，庆祝我们的结婚纪念日。

sentences.english: the party spirit
sentences.chinese: 参加社交聚会的乐趣

sentences.english: I have always voted for the Labour Party.
sentences.chinese: 我一直投工党的票。

detailed_translations.english: a social event when a lot of people meet together to enjoy themselves by eating, drinking, dancing etc

sentences.english: ‘The meal was absolutely delicious,’ she said politely.
sentences.chinese: “这顿饭味道好极了。” 她礼貌地说道。

sentences.english: the delicious smell of new-mown grass
sentences.chinese: 新修剪的草坪的芳香

detailed_translations.english: very pleasant to taste or smell
